free.freechess
Class FreechessConnection

java.lang.Object
  free.util.Connection
      free.freechess.FreechessConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class FreechessConnection
extends Connection
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class implements an easy way to communicate with a freechess.org server. It provides parsing of messages sent by the server and allows receiving notifications of various events in an easy manner.

Information usually arrives and is parsed/processed line by line. Usage usually involves overriding one of the many processXXX() methods and handling the arrived information. The boolean value returned by the processXXX() methods determines whether the arrived information has been processed completely and shouldn't be processed any further. Currently, returning false will mean that the line sent by the server will be sent to the processLine(String) method as well, but in the future "further processing" might include other procedures. Since by default, all the processXXX(parsed data) methods return false, the information usually handled by any methods you don't override will end up in processLine(String) which you can easily use for printing the output to the screen or a file.

filterLine

public void filterLine(java.lang.String line)
Adds the specified String to the list of lines that will be filtered. The next time this string is received (as a line), it will not be sent to the processLine method. Note that this only works for the first occurrance of the specified string.
